result.execSummary:
The defendant James A Phillips was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $150 fine plus costs. 60 days to pay fine/costs or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James A Phillips

records.addlTxt: 2:42 PM Defendant James A Phillips not in court, Attorney Mark Douglas Skvara appeared by video for James A Phillips, Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  State moves to amend Ct. 1 to a County Ordinance Disorderly Conduct. (31.01), moves to dismiss but read in Ct. 2.  Atty Skvara enters no contest plea on defendant's behalf to amended Ct. 1.  Court accepts plea, finds defendant guilty of amended Ct. 1, County Ordinance Disorderly Conduct.  Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing.  Bond is no longer in effect.
Status conference on January 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Atty Skvara and defendant appeared via zoom.

02:28 PM Defendant James A Phillips and Attorney Mark Douglas Skvara appear via zoom.  Nicholas Paul Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State indicates we can call case early, they are in compliance with victims rights as victim never responded to their request.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Skvara indicates he's received discovery, requests another status with hopes matter will resolve short of trial.  State has no objection.  Court inquires whether plea, when case is resolved, will be via zoom or in person.  Atty Skvara requests taking the plea via zoom as defendant lives in Florida.  State has no objection.  Court has no objection to proceeding with a misdemeanor plea/sentencing via zoom, will discuss this more with defendant when we get to that point.  Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for January 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on November 11, 2021 at 02:30 pm.
Atty Skvara and defendant appeared via zoom.

Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.  No violent contact with M.G.  (Clerk to send bond to defendant for signature and witnessed by law enforcement.  If bond not returned by 9/13/21, court will be reinstating the warrant)

02:04 PM Defendant James A Phillips and Attorney Mark Douglas Skvara appear via zoom.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea.  Court finds probable cause for bindover. Court quashes warrant. Bond set.  Court grants zoom appearance for 11/11/21 hearing.  Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2021 at 02:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on August 30, 2021 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Per email from Atty Heyne.  "I see that I am still listed as counsel of record for this case. After no contact with client for 60 days, we close the file. He then needs to contact our office again to start over. Please could you remove me from the case? Thanks!"   Atty Heyne removed from case. LS
Defense Discovery Demand
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand
Email from defendants girlfriend questioning how to take care of the warrant. Court responds - defendant can show up and answer to these charges. DTE
Defendant called, was advised that he has to appear in person before Court to have warrant quashed, was told bond hearings occur every day at 1:00.
from Anna Phillips re: warrant for her son.
Defendant called inquiring how to take care of the warrant. Clerk LS advised defendant it was a body only warrant, he would need to appear before the judge to take care of the warrant.
Defendant James A Phillips not in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant.

Defendant James A Phillips appears by phone.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, question defendant on phone appearance. Defendant is back in Florida working. Court questions defendant on when he's going to be back in Door County to resolve the case. Defendant thought the case was going to be thrown out. State indicates matter is not being thrown out. Defendant can be back in Door County when court schedules him to be. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant James A Phillips in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.  Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel.  Court questions Defendant, finds defendant competent to proceed, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Defendant to make appointment with DA.  Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 3/01/16
